messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] food..again
messages.msgSnippet: To take from others without asking is rude, Brett calls it bad manners. He s always had that view, except when it comes to his little brother! Myranda That s
messages.messageBody:
To take from others without asking is rude, Brett calls it bad manners. He's always had that view, except when it comes to his little brother!
Myranda

That's considered rude? At a Grandparent's house?
Wow.
My children have all food available all the time, they wouldn't think it rude
at all to just take a banana off the counter and eat it.

Ren




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: food..again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/23/02 2:52:36 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/23/02 2:52:36 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Why not? I know she keeps them on the counter and I seriously doubt my son
would be rude enough to take them without permission. >>

That's considered rude? At a Grandparent's house?
Wow.
My children have all food available all the time, they wouldn't think it rude
at all to just take a banana off the counter and eat it.

Ren
